org.codehaus.preon.el
Class OuterReference

java.lang.Object
  org.codehaus.preon.el.OuterReference
All Implemented Interfaces:
Descriptive, Reference<Resolver>, ReferenceContext<Resolver>
public class OuterReference
extends Object
implements Reference<Resolver>

A Reference to the outer context. This Reference will create new references (selectAttribute(String), selectItem(Expression), etc.) that will be based on the outerContext passed in. In order to make sure the originalContext will be preserved by wrapping these new References in objects that will handle all incoming calls appropriately.

Author:
Wilfred Springer (wis)

narrow

public Reference<Resolver> narrow(Class<?> type)
Description copied from interface: Reference
Narrow the reference to a reference of the given type. The resulting reference is expected to always evaluate to an instance of type.

In order to understand the effect of this operation, it is important to understand that there may sometimes be some ambiguity in a reference. Take for instance the MultiReference. Calling MultiReference.selectAttribute(String) will create another MultiReference, pointing to different properties of different types on different types of objects. Calling Reference.narrow(Class) will essentially drop all references not pointing to an instance of type.

Specified by:
narrow in interface Reference<Resolver>
Parameters:
type - Narrows the reference to a reference that is guaranteed to point to a subclass of type.
Returns:
A reference that is guaranteed to point to a subclass of type, or null if it cannot be narrowed.

Description copied from interface: Reference
Returns a boolean, indicating if the reference is based on the given context.

Specified by:
isBasedOn in interface Reference<Resolver>
Returns:
true if the outcome of the reference is based on the given context; false otherwise.
